desc: SYK encodes spleen tyrosine kinase, a signal transduction kinase that is recruited to cell surface receptors through binding of its SH2 domain and activated by phosphorylation (PMID:7538118). Syk activity is needed for B-cell and lymphatic system development (PMID:7477353,12522250). It is expressed mainly in hematopoietic cells but also in subsets of epithelial cancers regulating tumor invasion (PMID:10963601,17699797, 23609194). Activation of Syk may also be a mechanism of ovarian cancer cell chemo-resistance (PMID:26096845). It participates in signal transduction from the immunglobulin receptor in B-cells (PMID:23335753). Syk can activate Flt3 and is important for leukemia survival (PMID:24525236,19800574). Targeting SYK signaling is a potential therapeutic strategy in lymphoma therapy (PMID:26575169, 23764004). Case reports of translocations involving SYK have been reported in MDS and lymphomas (PMID:11159536,16341044).

desc: SYK encodes a tyrosine kinase involved in signal transduction. Upregulation of SYK is found in lymphomas, leukemias and select epithelial tumors.
